briefdescription.para: Alias for clarity when manipulating free lists.

memberdef.argsstring: (buddy_allocator_t *alloc, int min_order, int max_order, int grow_order)
memberdef.name: buddy_init

detaileddescription.para:
alloc
Allocator instance to initialise.
min_order
Minimum order (e.g. 6 for 64B blocks).
max_order
Maximum order (e.g. 22 for 4MB region).
grow_order
Order used when adding new regions (e.g. 22 for 4MB).
The allocator starts with no regions. The first region is allocated automatically on the first call to buddy_malloc, or may be added eagerly by growing manually.

briefdescription.para: Allocate a block of memory from the buddy allocator.

detaileddescription.para:
alloc
Allocator instance to allocate from.
size
Requested size in bytes.
Pointer to allocated memory, or NULL if out of memory.
If the active region cannot satisfy the request, a new region is automatically allocated of size (1 << grow_order). Returned blocks are aligned to their block size (power of two).

alloc
Allocator instance.
ptr
Pointer returned by buddy_malloc.
The block is returned to its owning regionâ€™s free list. If its buddy is also free, the two are merged into a larger block. The owning region is identified via a back-pointer stored in the block header.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a buddy allocator and free all regions.

detaileddescription.para:
alloc
Allocator instance.
All regions allocated internally via kmalloc() are freed with kfree_null(). The allocator is left in an empty state.

briefdescription.para: Duplicate a string into a buddy allocator heap.

detaileddescription.para:
alloc
Buddy allocator to allocate from.
s
NUL-terminated string to duplicate.
Newly allocated string copy, or NULL on OOM.
The returned string is allocated from the buddy allocator's private heap and must be freed with buddy_free.

briefdescription.para: Reallocate a block within a buddy allocator.

detaileddescription.para: Works like krealloc(): if ptr is NULL, behaves like buddy_malloc(). If size == 0, frees the block and returns NULL.

simplesect.para: Pointer to resized block, or NULL on OOM.

briefdescription.para: Growable multi-region buddy allocator for Retro Rocket subsystems.

detaileddescription.para:
Craig Edwards
A buddy memory allocator that provides malloc/free-like semantics on top of one or more contiguous backing pools. Each allocator instance manages a linked list of regions, allowing it to grow dynamically when out of memory. Regions are obtained from the Retro Rocket base allocator (e.g. via kmalloc).
Allocations are rounded up to the nearest power of two, with a minimum block size set by buddy_init. Freeing coalesces buddy blocks within a region to minimise fragmentation.

Complexity:
Allocation: O(log n) within a region (splitting blocks). O(1) typical due to "active region" fast path.
Free: O(1) using a region back-pointer in the block header.

Notes:
Not thread safe: wrap calls in a spinlock if used from multiple tasks.
Each allocated block has overhead to store its order and region.
Alignment is always a power of two, at least the minimum block size.
Internal fragmentation can be significant for small allocations.
Regions never merge with each other; fragmentation is managed per region.
